intro: Carlowrightia ovata, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has smooth, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Carlowrightia ovata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
